00021 int AttributeModel::rowCount(const QModelIndex&) const {
00022         return attributes_.size();
00023 }
00024 
00025 int AttributeModel::columnCount(const QModelIndex&) const {
00026         return 2;
00027 }
00028 
00029 QVariant AttributeModel::data(const QModelIndex& index, int role) const {
00030 
00031         // if not valid index then nothing is returned
00032         if (!index.isValid()) {
00033                 return QVariant();
00034         }
00035 
00036         // only displayRole and editRole are supported
00037         if (role != Qt::DisplayRole && role != Qt::EditRole) {
00038                 return QVariant();
00039         }
00040 
00041         // which column is asked
00042         switch (index.column()) {
00043         case 0: {
00044                 return attributes_.at(index.row())->name_;
00045         }
00046         case 1: {
00047                 return attributes_.at(index.row())->value_;
00048         }
00049         // invalid column
00050         default: {
00051                 return QVariant();
00052         }
00053         }
00054 }
00055 
00056 QVariant AttributeModel::headerData(int section, Qt::Orientation orientation,
00057                 int role) const {
00058 
00059         // only horizontal headers
00060         if (orientation != Qt::Horizontal) {
00061                 return QVariant();
00062         }
00063 
00064         // Headers are only displayed, they can not be edited
00065         if (role != Qt::DisplayRole) {
00066                 return QVariant();
00067         }
00068 
00069         switch (section) {
00070         case 0: {
00071                 return tr("Name");
00072         }
00073         case 1: {
00074                 return tr("Value");
00075         }
00076         // invalid section
00077         default: {
00078                 return QVariant();
00079         }
00080         }
00081 }
00082 
00083 bool AttributeModel::setData(const QModelIndex& index, const QVariant& value,
00084                 int role) {
00085 
00086         // only valid indexes
00087         if (!index.isValid()) {
00088                 return false;
00089         }
00090         // only edit role can edit
00091         else if (role != Qt::EditRole) {
00092                 return false;
00093         }
00094 
00095         // is name or value edited
00096         switch (index.column()) {
00097         case 0: {
00098                 attributes_.at(index.row())->name_ = value.toString();
00099                 emit attributeChanged(index.column());
00100                 return true;
00101         }
00102         case 1: {
00103                 attributes_.at(index.row())->value_ = value.toString();
00104                 emit attributeChanged(index.column());
00105                 return true;
00106         }
00107         // invalid column
00108         default: {
00109                 return false;
00110         }
00111         }
00112 }
00113 
00114 Qt::ItemFlags AttributeModel::flags(const QModelIndex& index) const {
00115 
00116         // if invalid index
00117         if (!index.isValid()) {
00118                 return Qt::NoItemFlags;
00119         }
00120 
00121         return Qt::ItemIsEnabled | Qt::ItemIsSelectable | Qt::ItemIsEditable;
00122 }

00124 QMap<QString, QString> AttributeModel::getAttributes() const {
00125         QMap<QString, QString> attributes;
00126 
00127         // go through all attributes stored in the model
00128         for (int i = 0; i < attributes_.size(); ++i) {
00129                 attributes.insert(attributes_.at(i)->name_,
00130                                 attributes_.at(i)->value_);
00131         }
00132 
00133         return attributes;
00134 }
00135 
00136 void AttributeModel::removeAttribute(QModelIndex index) {
00137 
00138         if (!index.isValid()) {
00139                 return;
00140         }
00141 
00142         beginRemoveRows(QModelIndex(), index.row(), index.row());
00143         attributes_.removeAt(index.row());
00144         endRemoveRows();
00145 
00146         // resize the columns to hold the attributes in case the columns can be 
00147         // resized
00148         emit attributeChanged(0);
00149         emit attributeChanged(1);
00150 }
00151 
00152 void AttributeModel::addAttribute(const QString& name, const QString& value) {
00153         beginInsertRows(QModelIndex(), attributes_.size(), attributes_.size());
00154         attributes_.append(QSharedPointer<AttributeModel::AttributePair>(
00155                         new AttributeModel::AttributePair(name, value)));
00156         endInsertRows();
00157 
00158         // resize the columns to hold the new attributes
00159         emit attributeChanged(0);
00160         emit attributeChanged(1);
00161 }
00162 
00163 bool AttributeModel::validAttributes() const {
00164 
00165         for (int i = 0; i < attributes_.size(); ++i) {
00166 
00167                 // if name or value is empty
00168                 if (attributes_.at(i)->name_.isEmpty()) {
00169                         return false;
00170                 }
00171                 else if (attributes_.at(i)->value_.isEmpty()) {
00172                         return false;
00173                 }
00174         }
00175         // no empty strings were found
00176         return true;
00177 }
00178 
00179 void AttributeModel::setAttributes(const QMap<QString, QString>& attributes) {
00180 
00181         beginResetModel();
00182 
00183         // remove the old attributes first
00184         attributes_.clear();
00185 
00186         // add all attributes from the map to this model
00187         for (QMap<QString, QString>::const_iterator i = attributes.begin();
00188                         i != attributes.end(); ++i) {
00189 
00190                 // add the pair to model data structure
00191                 AttributeModel::AttributePair* pair = new AttributeModel::AttributePair(
00192                                 i.key(), i.value());
00193                 attributes_.append(QSharedPointer<AttributeModel::AttributePair>(pair));
00194         }
00195 
00196         endResetModel();
00197 }
00198 
00199 void AttributeModel::clear() {
00200 
00201         beginResetModel();
00202         attributes_.clear();
00203         endResetModel();
00204 }
